awd_titl_txt: CAREER:  Uncertainty Quantification and Big Data Analysis in Interconnected Systems: Algorithms, Computations, and Applications
awd_abstract_narration:
Uncertainty quantification (UQ) and big data analysis have received increasing attention in recent years. Extensive research effort has been devoted to these topics, and novel numerical methods have been developed to efficiently deal with large-scale data sets and complex problems with uncertainty. Both UQ and big data analysis enable us to better understand the impacts of various uncertain inputs (boundary and initial data, parameter values, geometry, network etc.) to numerical predictions. UQ and big data analysis are thus critical to many important practical problems such as climate modeling, weather prediction, ocean dynamics, and smart grids. As the data size and dimensions of parameter space increase, one of the biggest challenges in UQ computations and big data analysis is the computational cost for analyzing the data and running the simulations. For large-scale complex interconnected systems, deterministic simulations can be very time-consuming, and conducting UQ simulations further increases the simulation cost and can be prohibitively expensive. This project aims to address these critical challenges. A novel set of highly efficient UQ and big data analysis algorithms will be developed to make big data analysis and UQ simulations amenable for large-scale complex interconnected systems. The new algorithms will significantly advance the current state of the art of UQ and big data analysis methods. The project also integrates educational opportunities, including exposing a range of undergraduate students to UQ and big data, giving graduate students the advanced skills needed to apply them, and mentoring Ph.D. students to be leaders in UQ and big data education and research. 

The approach under development in this research project is based on scalable algorithms for multivariate Bayesian-treed Gaussian process and power network reduction; high-dimensional UQ algorithms; dynamic state estimation and model calibration for non-Gaussian noisy data; and advanced stochastic contingency analysis. The new algorithms will be based on building multi-fidelity models in both network models and probability space. Such algorithms can accommodate big data in linear time. In addition, while current contingency analysis allows only assessment of a static power grid status without considering uncertainty, the new approaches will allow analysis of contingency dynamically and probabilistically for cascade failures. The new algorithms will allow investigators to establish an efficient framework to rigorously quantify the uncertainty, analyze big data, and endow smart grid simulations with a composite error bar.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
Project Outcome Report

Major Research Activities:

  1.  PI and his team have developed a series of theoretical tools and advanced algorithms to improve powerful uncertainty quantification, model reduction, big data analysis, and machine learning tools for improving deep learning. 
  2. PI organized a mini-symposium named “Scalable Trustworthy Deep learning for Predicting Complex Systems” at the SIAM Conference on Mathematics of Data Science, September 26 - 30, 2022, San Diego, California, U.S. PI Lin gave presentations there to report the results supported under the DOE ASCR project.
  3. PI organized a mini-symposium on Surrogate Modeling for Forward and Inverse Problems in Uncertainty Quantification at SIAM Conference on Uncertainty Quantification and gave an invited talk, on April 12-13, 2022, Atlanta, Georgia, US.
  4. PI organized a topic-contributed session and gave an invited talk at the 2022 Joint Statistical Meeting, August 9, 2022, in Washington, DC, US.
  5. PI received the 2021 best paper award in Engineered Science Materials and Manufacturing Journal for the work titled “Real-Time  Precise damage characterization in self-sensing materials via neural network-aided electrical Impedance tomography: A computational study” supported by this grant. 
  6. PI also collaborated with Dr. Nick Winovich from Sandia National Laboratory on this project on improving the credibility and quantifying the uncertainties in functional deep learning algorithms, and applying them to real-world material modeling applications.

 

 Major Educational and Outreach Activities:

 

(1)   PI Lin sent a graduate student Yixuan Sun to do a summer internship at DOE Argonne National Laboratory in 2021 to work on developing deep learning algorithms for anomaly detection of traffic networks.

 

(2)   PI has co-organized an IMPACT Data Science Education workshop and gave an invited talk at Purdue, through which, we train our faculty to create data science modules into the course they regularly teach to better prepare Undergraduates to lead into the Future.

 

(3)   This project has provided tremendous training and professional development opportunities for the undergraduates and graduates supported under this grant, including journal publications and top conference presentations.

 

(4)   Trained and engaged 2 Ph.D. students from Purdue College of Engineering and College of Science (Yixuan Sun and Jiahao Zhang)

Significant results:

  PI has published over 10 prestigious international peer-reviewed journals and conference publications under the support of this grant.

  1. PI has developed a novel algorithm named Interacting Contour Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics to train large-scale neural networks and quantify its uncertainties. This work is published at the Tenth International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2022, Virtual Meeting. (Tier 1 AI conference), Apr 25 – 29, 2022.
  2. PI and his team have developed a novel replica exchange stochastic gradient MCMC via variance reduction approach. This work was published at the Ninth International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2021, Virtual Meeting. (Tier 1 AI conference), May 4th-7th, 2021.
  3. PI and his team have developed Deep Graph Operator Network, which can learn, and zero-shot transfer the dynamic response of networked systems. This work is published in IEEE Systems Journal in 2023.
  4. PI and his team have developed a physical-guided bi-fidelity Fourier-featured operator learning framework. This work is published at Fluids in 2023.
  5. PI and his team have developed a marginalized graph kernel based Gaussian process that can conduct interpretable molecular property predictions. This work is published in Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling in 2023.
  6. PI and his team have developed a novel multi-element flow-driven spectral chaos (ME-FSC) method for uncertainty quantification of dynamical systems. This work is published in the Journal of Computational Physics in 2022.
  7. PI and his team have developed a novel query-sparse transformer neural network for post-fault power voltage prediction. This work was published at 2022 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing, 22-27 May 2022, Singapore.
  8. PI and his team have developed a 1D-CNN with spatial coupling for post-fault power grid voltage prediction. This work was published at Artificial Intelligence for Industries.

por.por_txt_cntn:
Project Outcome Report


Major Research Activities: 

PI and his team have developed a series of theoretical tools and advanced algorithms to improve powerful uncertainty quantification, model reduction, big data analysis, and machine learning tools for improving deep learning.
PI organized a mini-symposium named Scalable Trustworthy Deep learning for Predicting Complex Systems at the SIAM Conference on Mathematics of Data Science, September 26 - 30, 2022, San Diego, California, U.S. PI Lin gave presentations there to report the results supported under the DOE ASCR project.
PI organized a mini-symposium on Surrogate Modeling for Forward and Inverse Problems in Uncertainty Quantification at SIAM Conference on Uncertainty Quantification and gave an invited talk, on April 12-13, 2022, Atlanta, Georgia, US.
PI organized a topic-contributed session and gave an invited talk at the 2022 Joint Statistical Meeting, August 9, 2022, in Washington, DC, US.
PI received the 2021 best paper award in Engineered Science Materials and Manufacturing Journal for the work titled Real-Time Precise damage characterization in self-sensing materials via neural network-aided electrical Impedance tomography: A computational study supported by this grant.
PI also collaborated with Dr. Nick Winovich from Sandia National Laboratory on this project on improving the credibility and quantifying the uncertainties in functional deep learning algorithms, and applying them to real-world material modeling applications.






Major Educational and Outreach Activities:





(1) PI Lin sent a graduate student Yixuan Sun to do a summer internship at DOE Argonne National Laboratory in 2021 to work on developing deep learning algorithms for anomaly detection of traffic networks.





(2) PI has co-organized an IMPACT Data Science Education workshop and gave an invited talk at Purdue, through which, we train our faculty to create data science modules into the course they regularly teach to better prepare Undergraduates to lead into the Future.





(3) This project has provided tremendous training and professional development opportunities for the undergraduates and graduates supported under this grant, including journal publications and top conference presentations.





(4) Trained and engaged 2 Ph.D. students from Purdue College of Engineering and College of Science (Yixuan Sun and Jiahao Zhang)


Significant results:


PI has published over 10 prestigious international peer-reviewed journals and conference publications under the support of this grant.

PI has developed a novel algorithm named Interacting Contour Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics to train large-scale neural networks and quantify its uncertainties. This work is published at the Tenth International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2022, Virtual Meeting. (Tier 1 AI conference), Apr 25  29, 2022.
PI and his team have developed a novel replica exchange stochastic gradient MCMC via variance reduction approach. This work was published at the Ninth International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2021, Virtual Meeting. (Tier 1 AI conference), May 4th-7th, 2021.
PI and his team have developed Deep Graph Operator Network, which can learn, and zero-shot transfer the dynamic response of networked systems. This work is published in IEEE Systems Journal in 2023.
PI and his team have developed a physical-guided bi-fidelity Fourier-featured operator learning framework. This work is published at Fluids in 2023. 
PI and his team have developed a marginalized graph kernel based Gaussian process that can conduct interpretable molecular property predictions. This work is published in Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling in 2023.
PI and his team have developed a novel multi-element flow-driven spectral chaos (ME-FSC) method for uncertainty quantification of dynamical systems. This work is published in the Journal of Computational Physics in 2022.
PI and his team have developed a novel query-sparse transformer neural network for post-fault power voltage prediction. This work was published at 2022 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing, 22-27 May 2022, Singapore.
PI and his team have developed a 1D-CNN with spatial coupling for post-fault power grid voltage prediction. This work was published at Artificial Intelligence for Industries.
